pageContext.claim: “And when you look at St. Louis with two people that came out, they were going to be beat up badly if they were lucky.”
pageContext.analysis: After reviewing visual evidence of the encounter, the St. Louis Dispatch reported, “Portland Place, protester Derek Brown’s live feed shows he is one of the first protesters to pass through the iron gate held open by protester Tory Russell. Although the McCloskeys [who Trump is referencing] have displayed photos of a crumpled gate as evidence the protesters broke it down, the feed shows the gate is intact. It was not clear when it was damaged. The first few protesters who enter the private neighborhood swerve away from the McCloskey house to walk in the street. None of the protesters [were] on his property.” Put simply, the visual evidence does not back up Trump’s claims.
